controller

Class NetworkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.NetworkManager

  • public class NetworkManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the methods to set up a network and manage it, which is useful in both CLUI and GUI.
    Author:
    Pietro Dellino

      • getNetworks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Network> getNetworks()

      • setupNetwork

        public Network setupNetwork(java.lang.String name)
                     throws ExistingNameException
        This method returns a Network object with 10 stations placed in a square area of size 4km, each station has 10 slots and the occupation rate of the network is 75%.
        Parameters:
        name - (String) The name of the network
        Returns:
        a Network
        Throws:
        ExistingNameException
        See Also:
        setupNetwork(String, int, int, double, int)

      • setupNetwork

        public Network setupNetwork(java.lang.String name,
                            int nStation,
                            int nSlot,
                            double s,
                            int nBikes)
                     throws ExistingNameException
        This method sets up a network according to the parameters. The stations are placed according to getPointDistribution.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network
        nStation - The number of stations
        nSlot - The number of slots of each station
        s - The side of the square area to place the stations
        nBikes - The total number of bikes
        Returns:
        a network
        Throws:
        ExistingNameException
        See Also:
        getPointDistribution(int, double)

      • getPointDistribution

        public Point[] getPointDistribution(int N,
                                    double s)
        This functions returns an array of points in a square of side s. The area is divided in enough little squares to place all the points, and then each point is placed randomly on a little square. That ensures that each point is at a different place.
        Parameters:
        N - (int) the number of points
        s - (double) the side of the square
        Returns:
        an array of Point where the points are equally distributed on the area
